instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message:
Yes I'm pretty new at this. No I haven't found an article for this specific issue:)

I tried this first with the board out and no LCD connected.. I assume this is the wrong way to test circuits so I connected the LCD panel.

Here is what I found and can you please assist me in sorting this out? one odd thing I found is that as I tested some pins on some Resistors etc. The voltage was slowly decreasing.

Thank you in advance,
Chris

U7700 pin 17 en  3.3v
F7700 12.58v

PPVIN_S0w_LCDBKLT_R  pin 1 c7700 12.58V  pin 2 12.78V
R7701 pin 1 12.59v  Pin 2 12.48V

Q7700
Pin 1  10.2v and decreasing
Pin2  8.36 and decreasing
Pin3  12.49v
Pin4  12.59v
Pin5  7.62 decreasing
Pin67.02 decreasing

L7710 PIN 1 8.2V and decreasing  PIN 2 8.1V Decreasing

PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT
J8300 Pin 1 12.5V

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message: Voltage on Pin 30??? If you use a flashlight , can you see any image???? have you tried whit a known good display assembly??

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message:
Cant believe I missed this reply.. been waiting.. Damn.

Yes the LCD is good. Can see the Apple Logo etc. HDMI port works also.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message: Read again and answer question.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message:
I had the original LCD and had a an image but no backlight.  Now, With the board out of the case but plugged into the LCD I cant even see an image..
Pin 30 has 5.1V

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message: I put the board back into the case and I have a no backlight scenario. There is video, just no backlight. with 5.1V at pin 30

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message: With 5V on pin 30 there should be something on the LCD. What voltage is on pin 1? Only 2015 LCD assemblies will work on these boards, make sure you have the correct one.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message: This is the original one for this MBP  Pin 1 has 12.54V.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message:
So it is not boosting. Was this liquid damage? 
Voltage on R7742, with LCD connected.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message: Yes, liquid damage. Bad keyboard also.(not connected) 3.3v on R7742 with the lcd connected

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message:
Corrosion in U7700 area? Check feedback circuit R7731/32
Where was corrosion?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message:
no obvious corrosion. I see a very little bit at these 3 resistors
R7731 12.5v on pin 1  nothing on pin 2..   no voltage on either side of R7732..  
R7731  Nothing..
R7732 150k Ohms

Looks like R7731 is bad

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message:
What a pain no 13.3k resistors  on any of my bad boards
...

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message: So I finally found a 13.7 not the 13.3..... will this work?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message: That's only a 3% difference; if it's the same package, and will fit without issues, it should be fine as long as the original spec tolerance is 5%.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message: Tolerance is 1% on these

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message: Yeah, then it won't work. Find one in-spec is your best bet.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message:
Damn... yea well without ordering 100 of them it's a challenge.. I wish Lewis sold a kit with the top 20 components..
ill just keep searching. Thank you for your help.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message: Will work just fine...

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message:
[QUOTE="Allstartek, post: 19800"]Damn... yea well without ordering 100 of them it's a challenge.. I wish Lewis sold a kit with the top 20 components..
ill just keep searching. Thank you for your help. [/QUOTE]

I created one for the air and it got one sale. and six hours of assembly time. never again.

Try the 13.7k and see what happens.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-4924 no backlight
threads.message:
Finally!  Cheese and Rice.. This was a real pain.. As it tuned out, there was a test point Tp[1]LCDBKLT_FB had what looked like very minor corrosion, almost not visible..  I couldn't get continuity between R7732 and the test point 2 millimeters to the left of the Resistor..  This goes directly to Pin 21 on U7700...

I soldered a wire in place and wahlah (badabing in NYC area) I have video..

Thank you for the help and patience..  :)
